utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, it’s almost time.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: All right. Shall we review?

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM SINGH
utterance.content: Please.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, according to Caleb this phone is going to ring at exactly 8AM. Now because it’s GPS enabled it will only work in this particular park.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: At which time an electronically altered voice, most likely LokSat’s, will issue Caleb his orders.

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: Orders that I’ll intercept and trace with a cellular relay.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, I’m going to attach you to the relay. You connected, Vikram?

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: Synched up and ready to go. Guys, this is it. If all goes well we’ll identify LokSat and finally take his ass down.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And if anything goes sideways we immediately shut it down and meet up at the precinct. Got it?

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: Roger that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You thinking what I’m thinking?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mmhmm. You want a Fudgsicle, too? I know, could be a trap.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Just because Caleb switched sides doesn’t mean that LokSat doesn’t have him under surveillance. Any one of these people could be a LokSat agent. Or even LokSat himself.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You care to put a wager on it?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A wager on what?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: On which one’s LokSat. I got twenty bucks says that it’s that handsy yogi over there.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m going for the carrot-top Cruella DeVille. Wait a minute, does she look a little bit like your first ex-wife?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She kind of does. Oh my God, could my ex-wife be LokSat? Because in a lot of ways that would make perfect sense.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, Vikram, here we go.

utterance.speaker: ROBOT VOICE
utterance.content: Good morning, Caleb. I have an urgent matter for you. There’s an abandoned warehouse near Broadway and Flushing in Brooklyn. There’s a security booth in the parking lot. Dead drop a flash drive with the new bank routing numbers in the top drawer of that booth at precisely noon today for my accountant to retrieve. That is all for now.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did you get a trace?

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: No, the call was short. Wait, I’ve got something. Oh no, it says here the call originated in Dye-2.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, what’s that?

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: It’s an abandoned cold war radar station in the Arctic Circle. LokSat must have set up a cellular relay there. Guys, this is a dead end.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Or … is it an opportunity? We all heard Caleb’s instructions.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: LokSat’s accountant is going to expose himself at that dead drop.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Talk about high on the food chain. We get LokSat’s accountant …

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It could bring us one step closer to LokSat himself. Vikram, send an encrypted email to Caleb. He’s going to have to show up at that dead drop. And you have to get ahold of Hayley. We need all the help we can get.

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: No matter how long I’ve been on the job, burned ones always get me.

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo Lanie, do we have a name?

utterance.speaker: LANIE PARISH
utterance.content: No, he’s a John Doe.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Do we know who owns the car?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: It was stolen last night from a used car lot. Unfortunately I can’t tell you much right now other than the victim was male, and you see these burnt remnants around his legs, hands, and face?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Duct tape?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Yep. Our victim was bound, gagged, and very much alive when the killer lit the fire.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hell of a way to go.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo, this is an Endicott briefcase, very high end. You can still make out the serial number on the frame. If we’re lucky, our victim registered it and we can get his name that way.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The killer chose this location for a reason. Vacant buildings on either side, not a security camera in sight. It rained last night, so clearly these tracks were made afterwards.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: They might be from the killer walking to his getaway car.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. You know, why don’t we make impressions of all the shoeprints and tire tracks. Maybe we’ll get lucky.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY SHIPTON
utterance.content: And what do I need these for?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Like I said, you’re the lookout. When we do our surveillance of LokSat’s accountant we’re going to need you to find a high vantage point. Be our eye in the sky.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There’s not a guitar in there, is there?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Not the kind that plays music.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh, Hayley?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Hmm?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: In case anything goes wrong –

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: I will get Martha and Alexis here and I will protect them. You have my word.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you. I owe you one. And by one I mean more like one dozen.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Mmm.

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: After we take down LokSat I’m thinking I might tender my resignation.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So you want to go back to being an government analyst?

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: I want to go back to being boring. I’ve kind of forgotten what that feels like. I know, that probably sounds stupid.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, no. Not at all. Thank you for doing this with me.

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: Are you kidding? Thank you – – for everything. Almost there.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. Almost. Speaking of, we should head out.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey, Captain. I’m sorry, are we – are we interrupting something?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, no. What’s going on?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, we got a lead on our homicide. The tire impressions made by our killer’s getaway car show that the wheels were staggered, meaning the ones in the back were larger than the ones in the front.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So the car’s exotic?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Specifically it means that the car was either mid or rear engine. So even though we don’t have any traffic cams from near the crime scene we can scrub footage from the surrounding areas and then –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hopefully find a car that fits the bill. Okay. Good job. I’ll leave you guys to it.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo, Beckett. Is there something going on that we should know about?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Vikram, you got a view on that security booth?

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: Completely unobstructed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. Between the both of us we should get a good photo of that accountant.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Are you sure that’s all we’ll need?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. Vikram’s going to run the accountant’s photo through facial recognition. We’ll ID it and then we’ll track him down later. Hayley, you in position?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: That’s an affirmative.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Your guitar all tuned up, ready to play?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Just about.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, you see anything?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nah. Just two sewer rats fighting over a piece of pizza.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hayley?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You see anything?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: All’s quiet on the western front.

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: I don’t get it. Caleb sent me back an encrypted email confirming he’d make the drop at noon sharp.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Don’t worry. He’ll be here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What f-stop are you using?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Excuse me?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: F-stop. It’s a function of the camera. It tells it how much light to –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, no, I know what an f-stop is. This isn’t a shoot for National Geographic. It’s on auto.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, no, no, no. Never use auto. Here, let me get that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, stop messing with my stuff.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I thought you liked it when I messed with your stuff.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Hey, um, I hate to interrupt your pillow talk but Caleb Brown’s just arrived.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, guys. Eyes peeled. The accountant’s going to be nearby.

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: All right, Caleb’s making the drop.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Espo. Kind of busy here.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I know, I know. But listen, I traced the serial number on the briefcase from the crime scene. It belongs to Caleb Brown. So I had the lab run his DNA. It’s a match. Caleb’s dead. He’s our victim.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Espo? Are you there?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What is it?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s not Caleb. Castle, this is a trap.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Anyone there? Can you hear us?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hayley? Vikram?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: They’ve got a frequency jammer. Castle, we’re cut off.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Uh oh.

utterance.speaker: MAN
utterance.content: Open fire!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle!

utterance.speaker: MAN
utterance.content: Sniper!

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: I don’t have a clear shot.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. Same.

utterance.speaker: MASON WOOD
utterance.content: Get in!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mason?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Ugh. We’re out of here.

utterance.speaker: MASON
utterance.content: No one’s following. We’re clear.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That … was amazing! Mason, you sir are, quite literally, a lifesaver. And talk about a getaway vehicle. A Korean barbeque taco truck? Are you serious? Is anyone hungry right now? Because I could totally whip up some kimchi tostados.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who are you?

utterance.speaker: MASON
utterance.content: Whoa, easy now.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whoa, whoa, whoa. No, no, no, no. Kate, Kate, Kate. This is Mason Wood. He’s the head of the Greatest Detective Society. I told you about meeting him in LA.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That doesn’t mean that we can trust him.

utterance.speaker: MASON
utterance.content: Fine, don’t trust me. But would you mind pointing that thing away from me? It makes me just a bit nervous.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Don’t worry, she’s out of bullets.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why would you tell him that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Because he saved our lives! And he’s a friend.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who just happened to be at the right place at the right time with the right Korean barbeque truck? I don’t think so.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She does make a good point. Mason, what are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: MASON
utterance.content: Your mother sent me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: My mother?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know Martha?

utterance.speaker: MASON
utterance.content: No. Not that mother. The other one. The stepmother. Rita.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How do you know her?

utterance.speaker: MASON
utterance.content: Once upon a time I was a lawyer with the state department and on an overseas assignment Rita was in my convoy going to the embassy. We were hit, we were taken hostage. If it hadn’t been for Rita I – – look, I just owe her, all right? And when she called and said that you two were sticking your noses into something dangerous and needed a babysitter, I said okay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did she tell you about LokSat? How he’s connected to -

utterance.speaker: MASON
utterance.content: Ok, now stop right there. Now, whatever this is and whoever you have obviously pissed off, the less I know about this the better my chances are of staying alive. Remember, I’m just a babysitter, so I’ll change your diapers and feed you your bottle and save you from a strike force of armed mercenaries, but I am not joining your fight.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Here, give me your cell phone. Hit squad can find us on it. I’m going to dump them.

utterance.speaker: MASON
utterance.content: Here. You’re welcome to take anything you need. It’s all untraceable. Good luck to both of you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How do we thank you?

utterance.speaker: MASON
utterance.content: You solved my friend’s murder back in LA. Let’s call it even.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How did that happen? We were careful.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: LokSat must have discovered that Caleb betrayed him and then got wind of us.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So LokSat killed Caleb and then all he had to do was hack into Caleb’s account and send a fake email to Vikram agreeing to make that drop.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: LokSat is going to keep coming for us. Or worse, he’s going to come after our families.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, well my dad’s away on business so he’s okay for now. But you’ve got to get Hayley to pick up Alexis and Martha and take them to the PI office safe room.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What about Vikram? He’s in danger, too.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’ll track him down and then we’ll meet up and we’ll make a plan. No, no, no. Don’t give me that face. Just say we’ll meet at the PI office.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We’ll meet at the PI office.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I love you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I love you, too.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey. Still haven’t found any mid or rear engine cars yet but I still have several traffic cams to scrub through, so –

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No, check this out. CSU uncovered a message in that burned out truck. Now, I think it was from Caleb. He must have scratched it when the killer was driving him to that empty parking lot. He carved it into the metal. It survived the blaze.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Was he trying to ID his killer for us? RT HD MN?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Right hand man.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Whose right hand man?

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: LokSat’s.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Who’s LokSat?

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: Caleb left that message for Beckett.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You’re still not answering the question, Vikram. Who the hell is LokSat?

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: The big bad wolf. The person behind Senator Bracken, Allison Hyde, the hit squads. Every terrible thing that’s happened to me and Beckett the last nine months.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You shouldn’t have told them.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. You should have.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Now tell us everything.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Come on.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: No, no, no, no, no. He’s okay. He’s okay, he’s okay. It’s about bloody time you got here.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA RODGERS
utterance.content: Oh, Richard! Darling! Oh, thank goodness you’re all right.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Where’s Katherine?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She’s coming.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS CASTLE
utterance.content: So what’s going on? Why are we in lockdown?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You didn’t tell them?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Considering the danger, I didn’t think it was my place.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad, does this have something to do with what you found out in LA?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Of course. I apologize. You – you both have a right to know. This all started when –

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So Caleb was burned alive because LokSat found out he switched sides and was working with you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. And now LokSat is going after Vikram, Castle, me … anyone that knows anything about them. So I need you guys to forget everything that you just heard.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh no, afraid we can’t do that, boss.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You guys, LokSat took out my entire AG team. I’m not going to let that happen to you.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We’re not going to let you go to war without your two best soldiers.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Right now there’s no war to be fought. Castle and I are probably going to have to disappear for a while. At least until we find another lead on LokSat.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Beckett, we already have one. Caleb IDed his killer. LokSat’s right hand man. You know what this means?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Catching Caleb’s killer will put us on a path to LokSat.

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: Guys? I got him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The right hand man?

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: Yeah. I found a credit card hit off of Caleb’s financials. He ate alone at a diner last night. They just emailed me the security cam footage from the parking lot.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That’s Caleb with the briefcase?

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: Yes. And that’s got to be LokSat’s right hand man.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So this is right before he torched Caleb. He never had a chance.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Can you run facial recognition?

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: No, we only have his profile.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: LokSat and his cleaner have had us running for cover like they’re the hunters. That’s good. They’ll never see us coming.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s not what we agreed to. You were supposed to grab Vikram and then come straight here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I – I know. But that was before the guys were brought in on this and before we got actual evidence on LokSat. I can’t leave now.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, then I’m coming down there.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I – no. No. Absolutely not. You can’t risk coming out in the open.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And you can’t risk staying in the open.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, I am in one of the safest buildings in the city. A police station. And better yet, my police station with my cops. Nothing’s going to happen to me while I’m here.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Captain Beckett?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Babe, I’ve gotta go.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Will you stay at the precinct?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes. I promise. I’ll stay here. I love you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I love you, too.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What’ve you got?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We found him.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So we scrubbed through every available traffic cam around the crime scene and we were only able to find one car with staggered wheels due to being mid-engine.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Which matches the tire impressions that we found at the crime scene.

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: This is the car five blocks from the vacant lot driving away.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No plate. So how do we know that LokSat’s right hand man is driving the car?

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: Just wait. Using traffic cams we can follow the car to what we assume is his house.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That’s him all right.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who owns the home?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: A shell corporation.

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: Now watch. This is a live shot. He’s still there.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right. Grab your tact gear. We’re going to that house.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Excuse me, Beckett. Correct me if I’m wrong, but didn’t you just tell Castle that you’re staying put at the precinct?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You think I’m going to send you into harm’s way while I’m sitting safe behind a desk? No. Not going to happen.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You’ve got a target on your back. We don’t. You’re staying here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He does know that I’m Captain, right?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yes, ma’am. You can fire us both for insubordination, otherwise we’ve got this.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: A feisty merlot, an elegant spread, delightful company... if I wasn’t scared out of my mind this would be a lovely afternoon.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I should be with Kate. I promised her we’d take down LokSat together.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: You also promised you’d stay here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m going to the precinct.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, no!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’ll be fine. Don’t worry.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: I don’t think –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Don’t worry. It’s okay. It’s fine. It’ll be fine. Don’t worry. I will see you soon. Okay?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: See you soon.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: You can’t go out there alone. Someone has to watch your back.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Someone has to watch theirs. I don’t know those guys out front. I know you. Stay with them. Please.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No need. I’m armed. I’m packing. See? I’ll be fine.

utterance.speaker: HAYLEY
utterance.content: Be careful.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Okay, Beckett. We’re ready to breach.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Go.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: NYPD!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Move!

utterance.speaker: SWAT MEMBER
utterance.content: Front room clear!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Room all clear!

utterance.speaker: SWAT MEMBER
utterance.content: Get the closets.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Come on, guys. Talk to me. What do you see?

utterance.speaker: SWAT MEMBER
utterance.content: Bedroom clear.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Place is empty, Captain.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: By empty we mean completely empty. No furniture, no right hand man, no nothing. Beckett, he tricked us.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Twelfth Precinct, please. 24th and 7th. As fast as you can.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: CSU’s taking the place apart.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: They’re not going to find anything. The place was a waystation.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You think he planned for us to follow him there?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: LokSat’s people are CIA, which means they are experts at tactical subterfuge. My guess is that Mr. Right Hand Man anticipated our ability to track down his vehicle from the crime scene and he led us to a place where he knew he could lose us.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And your guess would be right. Surveillance cameras on the street behind the house were disabled yesterday morning.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So our guy walked right in the front door and right out the back.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which means we have no idea of knowing where he went.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who are you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s an embarrassing name, isn’t it? Like A Boy Named Sue? Maybe your mother called you Doofus.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So you can kill them? Forget it. I’m not telling you anything. I’m not betraying them. I don’t care how many thumbscrews you put to me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Dead end is not good enough! This guy doesn’t get to be smarter than us. There’s too much at stake here. If we lose this thread then we’re just sitting ducks. I need a miracle, guys.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Okay. You got it.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: One miracle coming up.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle?

utterance.speaker: MASON
utterance.content: No, it’s Mason Wood.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh … I thought that you were done with us.

utterance.speaker: MASON
utterance.content: I was. But unfortunately for me, I think I may have a lead that can help you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What kind of a lead?

utterance.speaker: MASON
utterance.content: A source that I worked with in the early 'aughts. He’s a facilitator for extralegal intelligence operations. If anyone knows the dark side of the CIA it’s him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Good. Then we’ll go see him.

utterance.speaker: MASON
utterance.content: No, no. Not we. Me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, Mason –

utterance.speaker: MASON
utterance.content: This guy’s default setting is early 70s conspiracy thriller. He won’t talk to you. Hell, he might not even talk to me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mason, this is my fight and you’re not going to know the right questions to ask. I have to be there.

utterance.speaker: MASON
utterance.content: All right. Meet me in a hour at the corner of Grand and East Broadway.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well then, why don’t you unstrap me and I’ll come give you a big hug?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I fell in love with her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Because I’d never met anyone like her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, but you don’t have the legs. Or the eyes. Or the brains or the heart. Beckett makes me laugh. She challenges me. I became a better man … why am I telling you this?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What’s the alternative? To be like you? A man, alone, without empathy?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, I wouldn’t.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She’s going to find you. You, and LokSat, and she’s going to bury you both. And I can’t tell a lie, right?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You seen Beckett?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: Hey guys? I got something.

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: I pulled all active and passive cell phone signals originating from the cell tower that served the empty house.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That must have been hundreds.

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: Try thousands. Which was daunting. But then I screened them against phone signals along the route the right hand man took from the crime scene to the house and those IMEI numbers started to shrink. Until … only one remained. That, gentlemen, is right hand man’s phone number.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Can you locate where that phone is right now?

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: I can try.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know, you don’t have to do this. Clearly you’re looking for something more.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Look, um … maybe I could make a quick trip to the little boy’s room before we get started with any more questions.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who will?

utterance.speaker: MASON
utterance.content: Surprise.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re LokSat?

utterance.speaker: MASON
utterance.content: Yes. Although technically that’s the codename for my extralegal operations.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So everything that happened in LA, the GDS? That was all a lie?

utterance.speaker: MASON
utterance.content: Oh, no, no, no, no. The Greatest Detective Society is very real and connected in no way to my work with the CIA. Think of it as a – – a fun hobby.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: My stepmother. Is she dead?

utterance.speaker: MASON
utterance.content: Not yet. But I needed you to trust me so I could find out who else knew about my existence before I kill you two. So let’s get right to it because I have to meet your wife in – – just a few minutes. Is he ready?

utterance.speaker: MASON
utterance.content: All right, then. Truth time. Who knows about me? Beckett, obviously. And Vikram. What about Hayley Shipton?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: MASON
utterance.content: Detectives Ryan and Esposito?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: MASON
utterance.content: And what about your mother?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: MASON
utterance.content: Ah. Your daughter?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: MASON
utterance.content: Yes. Ah. Anyone else?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: MASON
utterance.content: Good. That will be a weight off my shoulders, once everyone has been neutralized.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Don’t do this. Please.

utterance.speaker: MASON
utterance.content: There is no shame in losing, Mr. Castle. Only in the hubris that made you think this could end any other way.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: NYPD. We have reason to believe there’s a murder suspect in this building. We need to search it from top to bottom.

utterance.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
utterance.content: Sorry, Officer, but that’s not going to happen. This building belongs to the Central Intelligence Agency. It’s protected by the National Security Act. I can’t let you in.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I don’t care if it’s protected by the Hulk. We’re going to tear this place apart.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Where is this guy? Where is he?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What, no alcohol swab this time?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Or – and just go with me on this – we could just skip it. There’s no reason this has to end in tragedy.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: NYPD! Hands in the air! Now!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ryan!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You okay?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mason Wood is LokSat. He’s going after Beckett. He’s going to kill her. We have to warn her.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Dispatch, this is Esposito. I need backup –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We’ve gotta go.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Let’s move!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Go.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Call them off!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Where is Mason taking Beckett to kill her?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We’ll see.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I sure hope I get the correct dosage, because forgetting to breathe can be such a drag. Now, you’re going to tell me everything I want to know.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Where is Mason taking Beckett?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Where?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How do I get a message to Beckett?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How do we get out of here?

utterance.speaker: MASON
utterance.content: You and Mr. Castle have quite a bond. Unusual in your line of work.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah well, I’m crazy for him. He’s the love of my life. And he understands the sacrifices I have to make to do this job, so.

utterance.speaker: MASON
utterance.content: Clearly whomever you’re up against is quite deadly. Ever consider just walking away?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Every day.

utterance.speaker: MASON
utterance.content: Why didn’t you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I took an oath. People that I cared about were murdered and they deserve justice.

utterance.speaker: MASON
utterance.content: Must be hard, carrying that weight.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t carry it alone.

utterance.speaker: MASON
utterance.content: Here we are.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The wet wall.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What are you doing? That’s the street side. We can’t get out!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We don’t have to get out. We can get in. We can escape down there.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: If we stop shooting they’re coming in.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Don’t worry about us! Go get Beckett!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So who is this guy we’re going to see?

utterance.speaker: MASON
utterance.content: Oh, he’s sort of an Milo Minderbinder. Owes me for retrieving some things that were stolen from him.

utterance.speaker: MASON
utterance.content: He’s going to meet us down here. I told him you were coming. You better let me do all the talking in the –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Pull the gun out of your pocket. Two fingers, put it on the ground. Knock it off. I know it’s you. Now, gun! On the floor. Nice and slow.

utterance.speaker: MASON
utterance.content: I was, uh, worried you might be too smart to fall for this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What’s in the other pocket?

utterance.speaker: MASON
utterance.content: Oh, this is just insurance.

utterance.speaker: MASON
utterance.content: See, mine is made of plastic, so it’s unaffected by the electromagnet in the ceiling. And I’m afraid I have some more bad news for you. Your husband’s dead.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’re lying.

utterance.speaker: MASON
utterance.content: No, I’m not. He died about the same time I was picking you up. As a matter of fact, his body is in the furnace behind you there, being reduced to a few pounds of ashes.

utterance.speaker: MASON
utterance.content: I think it’s very fitting that your lives together end in fire, don’t you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m not going in there without a fight.

utterance.speaker: MASON
utterance.content: That’s very brave of you. But there won’t be much of a fight.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Drop the gun! Or I will kill you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, stand back!

utterance.speaker: NEWSCASTER
utterance.content: Meanwhile, in a dramatic scene, local and federal law enforcement officials descended on a federal building in Midtown tonight, rescuing several police officers and arresting almost a dozen people.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: How long before the CIA connection comes out?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Not long. It’s too big a story for the agency to bury.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Get ready for hearings out the wazoo.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: So, that’s it. We’re finally in the clear.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. So we’re going to go to a bar and celebrate.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. Have fun.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So, you handing in your resignation?

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: No … boring is overrated.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yo, Vikram! You coming?

utterance.speaker: VIKRAM
utterance.content: It’s seven in the morning.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’s New York City.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: I’m going to yell at you later, but for now I’m just glad you’re both okay.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh. Thank you.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey, Lanie. You coming?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: See ya.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I feel like I could sleep for a week.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How about some breakfast first? Best way to start off our hibernation.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know what? Why don’t we just order in? You don’t have to cook.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I love cooking for you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And I love when you cook for me. I’m going to go change.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey, Beckett?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: If Mason had an incinerator in the basement why wouldn’t he just dispose of Caleb’s body there?

utterance.speaker: CALEB BROWN
utterance.content: I told Mason you would figure it out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle?

utterance.speaker: CALEB
utterance.content: But the old man wouldn’t listen to me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Caleb – don’t –

utterance.speaker: CALEB
utterance.content: Sorry, Rick. But how am I going to enjoy my retirement with you and the missus hunting me?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT VOICEOVER
utterance.content: Well, I guess this is it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE VOICEOVER
utterance.content: Well, it doesn’t have to be. We could, uh, go to dinner, debrief each other.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT VOICEOVER
utterance.content: Why, Castle? So I can be another one of your conquests?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE VOICEOVER
utterance.content: Or I could be one of yours.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT VOICEOVER
utterance.content: It’s nice to meet you, Castle

utterance.speaker: CASTLE VOICEOVER
utterance.content: It’s too bad. It would have been great.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT VOICEOVER
utterance.content: You have no idea.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE VOICEOVER
utterance.content: Every writer needs a muse, and I found mine.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT VOICEOVER
utterance.content: Always.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE VOICEOVER
utterance.content: Always.
